protocol_name: Dispersing Labyrinthulomycete Cell Aggregates by Sonication
protocol_name_html: Dispersing Labyrinthulomycete Cell Aggregates by Sonication
description: Sonication procedure implemented to reduce labyrinthulomycete cell aggregation from culture for subsequent growth analyses.

groups.group_name: Protist Research to Optimize Tools in Genetics (PROT-G)

components.data: Turn on QSONICA Q800R Sonicator. Add required distilled water and allow the water to reach a temperature of 4 C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Turn on QSONICA Q800R Sonicator. Add required distilled water and allow the water to reach a temperature of 4 C.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 1 of Dispersing Labyrinthulomycete Cell Aggregates by Sonication
source_data.protocol_name: Dispersing Labyrinthulomycete Cell Aggregates by Sonication
source_data.protocol_name_html: Dispersing Labyrinthulomycete Cell Aggregates by Sonication

components.data: Pipette 1 - 1.2ml of cell culture into a 1.5ml eppindorf tube. Gently vortex. Invert the tube several times before placing in QSONICA adapter to maintain the cells in suspension.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pipette 1 - 1.2ml of cell culture into a 1.5ml eppindorf tube. Gently vortex. Invert the tube several times before placing in QSONICA adapter to maintain the cells in suspension.

components.data: Program QSONICA to sonicate for 1 minute at 100% amplitude followed by a 30 second intermission and another 1 minute at 100% amplitude. Put on necessary protective ear wear. Place the 1.5ml tubes of suspended cells into QSonica adapter and then into QSONICA. Close the lid of the machine and immediately begin sonication procedure by hitting START.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Program QSONICA to sonicate for 1 minute at 100% amplitude followed by a 30 second intermission and another 1 minute at 100% amplitude. Put on necessary protective ear wear. Place the 1.5ml tubes of suspended cells into QSonica adapter and then into QSONICA. Close the lid of the machine and immediately begin sonication procedure by hitting START.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 3 of Dispersing Labyrinthulomycete Cell Aggregates by Sonication
source_data.protocol_name: Dispersing Labyrinthulomycete Cell Aggregates by Sonication
source_data.protocol_name_html: Dispersing Labyrinthulomycete Cell Aggregates by Sonication
source_data.annotation:
Aurantiochytrium limacinum (ATCC MYA-1381)

Mass cell lysis was seen after 2 minutes of sonication at 100% amplitude

 

Schizochytrium aggregatum (ATCC 28209)

Can withstand up to 3 minutes sonication at 100% amplitude without significant cell lysis

 

Aplanochytrium stocchinoi

Can withstand 4 minutes at 100% amplitude with little to no visible cell lysis

Aurantiochytrium limacinum (ATCC MYA-1381)

Mass cell lysis was seen after 2 minutes of sonication at 100% amplitude

 

Schizochytrium aggregatum (ATCC 28209)

Can withstand up to 3 minutes sonication at 100% amplitude without significant cell lysis

components.data:
Identify cell mortality and remaining cell aggregation following sonication using microscopy and adjust sonication procedure as necessary. 

This protocol has been successfully used to break up aggregates of Aplanochyrium, Aurantiochytrium, and Schizochytrium from cultures grown in liquid 790 medium.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
